inlineContent.text: Learn how to modulate playing haptics in real-time
using CHHapticDynamicParameter.
Learn about dynamically adjustable parameter types.
Create an AdvancedPatternPlayer.
You must use advancedPlayer to apply
dynamic parameters.
CHHapticDynamicParameter allows you to change
characteristics of already-playing haptics in real-time.
Vibration intensity changes based on speed in games
Haptic feedback according to slider values
Interactive haptics responding to user gestures
Dynamically adjust haptic intensity based on
user input in games or interactive apps.
For example, in a racing game, you can implement
an effect where vibration increases as speed increases.
Prepare a Continuous pattern.
This pattern will have its intensity changed during playback.
Example of adjusting intensity based on slider value.
Apply real-time changes using the sendParameters() method.
Implement speed-based intensity control.
A good pattern for integrating with game physics engines.
Create a linearly increasing intensity curve.
Suitable for a “buildup” effect that gradually intensifies.
Define complex curves with multiple control points.
Create vibration patterns that rise and fall like waves.
Apply the parameter curve to a pattern.
CHHapticParameterCurve lets you pre-define
parameter changes over time.
This enables more efficient and smoother transitions
than calling sendParameters at runtime repeatedly.
Implement haptics linked to drag gestures.
Intensity changes based on drag distance.
Haptic feedback when zooming with pinch gesture.
The feeling changes based on zoom ratio.
Express the progress of a long press
through haptics.
Linking haptics with user gestures like
pan and pinch creates highly intuitive interfaces.
What Player is required to use CHHapticDynamicParameter?
The basic PatternPlayer doesn’t support dynamic parameters.
CHHapticPatternPlayer
CHHapticAdvancedPatternPlayer
Only AdvancedPatternPlayer created with
makeAdvancedPlayer() supports sendParameters().
Any Player works
Dynamic parameter functionality is only
available in AdvancedPatternPlayer.
What is the advantage of CHHapticParameterCurve?
ParameterCurve defines changes over time,
not intensity.
It can create stronger haptics
It’s more efficient than repeatedly
calling sendParameters at runtime.
Pre-defining parameter changes over time enables
efficient and smooth transitions
Audio synchronization is a separate topic.
ParameterCurve focuses on haptic parameter changes.
It can synchronize audio and haptics

abstract.text: Learn how to perfectly synchronize sound and vibration
to create immersive multimodal experiences.

metadata.title: Dynamic Haptics (CHHapticDynamicParameter)
metadata.category: Building a Haptic Feedback App with CoreHaptics

abstract.text: Build interactive haptic systems suitable for games
and learn how to create immersive gaming experiences.
Understand the Apple Haptic Audio Pattern (AHAP) file format
and learn how to collaborate with designers to manage haptics.
Learn how to combine various haptic events with CHHapticPattern
to create meaningful feedback.
Build interactive haptic systems suitable for games
and learn how to create immersive gaming experiences.
Understand the Apple Haptic Audio Pattern (AHAP) file format
and learn how to collaborate with designers to manage haptics.
Learn how to design and implement unique haptic signatures
that embody your brand identity.

and learn how to respect system accessibility settings.
